p: Cinnamomum cassia is an aromatic tree species belonging to the Lauraceae family. Cinnamon has been prominently used in traditional Chinese, Indian, Persian, and Unani medicine for a long time. Cinnamon has been used as a popular spice by different countries around the world for thousands of years. Cinnamon is obtained from the bark of its young branches which is widely used all around the world as a daily condiment. It can be also used as a material for medical products and has high economic value. It is used for several conditions such as; flatulence, amenorrhea, diarrhea, toothache, fever, leukorrhea, common cold, and headache. It has also been reported that the regular use of cinnamon averts throat infections (Hajimonfarednejad et al., 2018).
